titleStmt.title: Deuoreux Vertues teares for the losse of the most christian King Henry, third of that name, King of Fraunce; and the vntimely death, of the most noble & heroicall gentleman, VValter Deuoreux, who was slaine before Roan in Fraunce. First written in French, by the most excellent and learned gentlewoman, Madam Geneuuefue, Petau Maulette. And paraphrastically translated into English. Ieruis Markham.
titleStmt.author: Petau de Maulette, Geneviève.
Markham, Gervase, 1568?-1637.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I. Roberts, for Thomas Millington, and are to be sold at his shop in Corn-hill, vnder Saint Peters Church,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of a photostat of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: his shop in Corn-hill, vnder Saint Peters Church
